title: Flexi cap funds are back in favour. But do they really offer the best diversification?
summary: Flexi-cap funds may offer diversification without forcing exposure to expensive market segments. But these are not the only ones that promise diversification across market caps.

title: Stocks to buy for long term: From Bharat Forge, BoB to Bajaj Auto— Nirmal Bang suggests 10 shares for up to 50% returns
summary: Stocks to buy for the long term: According to Nirmal Bang, several stocks, including Bharat Forge, Bank of Baroda, Bajaj Auto, Paytm, and SRF, show strong bullish patterns. Key support levels are outlined, with expectations for upward price movements in the near term.

title: IIP data to FOMC minutes: Top five triggers for Indian stock market this week
summary: Top five stock market triggers next week: India's IIP data, FOMC minutes, Rupee outlook, gold and silver prices and FII Activity are the top five triggers for the Indian stock market.

title: Record IPO boom: Over 700 issues raise  ₹3.8 trillion in two years, young companies lead listings: Report
summary: In 2025, the Indian IPO market thrived with 365 companies raising  ₹1.95 trillion, driven by strong investor interest across sectors. Retail and foreign investors contributed significantly, highlighting a trend toward diversification and increased participation from younger firms.

title: Bitcoin price retraces 30% from record high. How does crypto market look like in 2026?
summary: Bitcoin has fallen roughly 30% from record high levels and is down more than 6% so far this year, as the market continues to find it difficult to recover after the October crash.

title: Infosys vs TCS vs Wipro vs HCL Tech: Which IT stock to buy ahead of Q3FY25 results?
summary: According to Sugandha Sachdeva- Founder-SS WealthStreet, large-cap IT stocks are beginning to show early signs of bottoming out, after a prolonged phase of correction, consolidation, and relative underperformance through most of 2025.

title: S&P 500 vs Nifty 50: Why  ₹1 lakh in US index earned more for Indian investors despite lower 10-year returns? Explained
summary: As per a Vested Finance analysis, the rupee has weakened against the dollar at a steady pace for more than 10 years, losing roughly 3% a year. In 2025 alone, the rupee has lost 6% as it plummeted to a record low of 91. Rupee has recovered some lost ground, but it still hovers around the 89.50 level.

title: 'We are the Lakshmi Mittals of AI industry...': Deepak Shenoy on why Indian investors should not fear missing AI boom
summary: Deepak Shenoy, founder and CEO of Capitalmind thinks AI as a theme is not lost for India. In fact, India's apparent late entry into the AI race may emerge as its strategic advantage.

title: 2025: A defining year that reshaped global trade, policy, and capital markets
summary: 2025 proved a transformative year, marked by the US's assertive 'America First' agenda and escalating global trade tariffs. India responded with significant economic reforms, including tax relief and a GST overhaul, while navigating volatile foreign investment flows. The year concluded with strong GDP growth, low inflation, and supportive monetary policy, positioning India for future resilience.

title: From rail to tech stocks: These 10 smallcap stocks post up to 35% weekly gains
summary: Indian equity markets saw mild profit booking near record highs. However, several smallcap stocks delivered sharp gains this past week. K&R Rail Engineering surged 34.32%. Jupiter Wagons rose 33.60%. Sasken Technologies gained 32.82%. Hindustan Copper and KNR Constructions also saw substantial increases. These stocks bucked the subdued market tone, showcasing strong individual performance.

title: Market outlook: FII trend, monthly expiry among top factors to track this week
summary: Indian markets are poised for a volatile week ahead, influenced by the December F&O expiry and crucial domestic data releases. Foreign institutional investors continue their selling spree, while global cues and currency movements also demand attention. Experts advise a cautious, stock-specific approach with disciplined risk management as the year concludes.

title: Expert view: Broad-based rallies in mid, small-caps like the past cycle unlikely in 2026, says Anand Rathi Chairman
summary: Anand Rathi's Chairman, Pradeep Gupta, shares insights on the Indian stock market, highlighting that 2026 will see earnings-led returns rather than broad-based rallies. He finds domestic cyclicals, such as those linked to capex, manufacturing, and infrastructure, attractive.

title: Gold rate today in India: 22-carat, 24-carat gold price in Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, other cities
summary: Gold rate today in India: Check how much gold costs in different cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Kolkata.

title: MCX silver jumps 40% in December alone, gains  ₹1,53,554 per kg in 8 months; analysts see further upside in 2026
summary: Silver prices have soared 175% in a year, driven by supply shortages and increasing industrial demand. Analysts expect continued gains as investment interest rises. The metal's inclusion in critical minerals lists and weakening dollar support prices.&nbsp;

title: India’s pension reset: Why 2025 was a turning point
summary: Structural changes were made to the NPS to increase its wider acceptance among households, while EPFO took some tough calls to plug complete withdrawals of the provident fund. Here are the headline events of 2025 in the space that you should take note of.

title: Up to 527% gain! 29 SME IPOs that delivered multibagger returns to investors in a rough year
summary: Despite a sharp slowdown in SME IPO performance in 2025, a select group of fundamentally strong stocks delivered multibagger returns, underscoring the growing importance of quality and disciplined stock selection.

title: 14 Penny stocks surged up to 440% in CY25; 6 emerge as multibaggers. Did you own any?
summary: In CY25, select penny stocks delivered sharp gains of up to 440%, with several emerging as multibaggers, highlighting strong momentum in low-priced micro-cap stocks despite elevated risks.

title: Silver rate today in India: 10 gm, 100 gm, 1 kg prices in Delhi, Jaipur, Mumbai, Bengaluru, other cities
summary: Silver rate today in Delhi for 10 gm coins is  ₹2,161, for 100 gm coins is  ₹24,614, whereas for 1 kg bar is  ₹2,40,150.

summary: PM Office directs Coal India to list all subsidiaries by 2030

title: Mcap of 7 of top-10 most valued firms declines by Rs 35,439 cr; SBI biggest laggard
summary: The combined market valuation of seven of the top-10 most valued firms declined by Rs 35,439.36 crore in a holiday-shortened last week, with State Bank of India taking the biggest hit, in line with a muted trend in equities.

title: Looking to invest in smallcaps in 2026? 5 big predictions by 5 experts
summary: After a steep underperformance in 2025, India’s smallcap stocks enter 2026 amid divided expert views. While some see improving earnings and selective opportunities, others warn valuations and ownership risks remain. Most strategists agree largecaps offer better visibility, with stock selection and active management critical in smaller segments.

title: Foreign investors exit Indian stocks at record scale; withdraw Rs 1.6 lakh cr in 2025
summary: Foreign investors fled Indian equities in 2025 at a scale never seen before, pulling out a record Rs 1.6 lakh crore (USD 18 billion) as volatile currency movements, global trade tensions, especially potential US tariffs, and stretched valuations eroded risk appetite, though flows are expected to turn sustainably positive in 2026.

title: Hybrid funds at the core of asset allocation for 2026: A practical playbook for balance, behaviour, and better outcomes
summary: As markets enter 2026 amid uncertainty, hybrid mutual funds offer a balanced, disciplined approach to portfolio construction by blending equity growth with debt stability, helping investors navigate volatility and stay aligned with long-term goals.

title: India’s growth story: Sectors poised to lead the next wave of market expansion
summary: India’s strong macro fundamentals, policy reforms, easing monetary conditions and revival in consumption and capex are expected to support growth and drive sectoral opportunities in FY27.

title: How Sundararaman Ramamurthy rebuilt BSE into a 14x wealth-creation machine in 3 years
summary: BSE has staged a remarkable turnaround since January 2023 under CEO Sundararaman Ramamurthy, driven by cost discipline, technology upgrades and the relaunch of equity derivatives. The strategy transformed market share, margins and investor confidence, delivering multi-fold returns and positioning BSE as a serious rival in index options.

title: Trading Nifty in the last week of 2025: Levels, flows and the Santa rally question
summary: As hopes of a Santa rally fade, traders enter the final week of 2025 focused on Nifty’s technical levels, FII positioning and derivatives cues. Analysts see key supports near 26,000, selective sector strength in defence stocks, and tactical buying opportunities in stocks like NBCC and DBL.

title: Market Trading Guide: Buy NBCC and Dalmia Bharat on Monday for up to 11% gains. Here’s why
summary: Indian equities extended losses for a second straight session as IT, financial and auto stocks weighed on benchmarks, pushing the Nifty below key short-term averages. Amid rising bearish momentum, analysts flagged 26,000 as a crucial support, while recommending NBCC and Dalmia Bharat on technical breakouts.

title: Hindustan Copper, RVNL, 8 other BSE 500 stocks surge up to 23% past week. Is yours on the list?
summary: Indian equities ended a holiday-shortened week with modest gains as benchmark indices consolidated amid mixed global cues and subdued participation. Despite cautious sentiment and FII selling, select BSE 500 stocks delivered strong weekly performances, led by metals, railways and PSU-linked names outperforming the broader market.

title: Stocks to buy under  ₹100: Sumeet Bagadia recommends three stocks to buy on Monday - 29 December 2025
summary: Sumeet Bagadia has recommended three stocks to buy on Monday, December 29. The three stock picks by Bagadia are - MMTC, Hardwyn India, and Sagility.

title: Retail frenzy drives 61 SME IPOs to 100–1,000x subscriptions in 2025; 15 turn multibaggers
summary: The IPO market thrived in 2025, with 365 offerings raising  ₹1.95 trillion and many SME issues seeing subscriptions over 100 times. While some stocks delivered substantial returns, most listings failed to maintain initial gains, exposing the gap between investor optimism and actual performance.

title: Shriram Finance deal: Will it bring the good days back? 5 NBFC stocks with a modest upside potential between 7% & 19%
summary: Read the headline, it says modest upside potential. Because, if one looks at analyst estimates, they are only moderately positive about the NBFC space. This was the case even a few months back. Since then, stocks like Shriram Finance have moved up sharply. Yes, it’s because a big stake deal has happened. But, the deal underlines the interest in the lending space, though with some caveats. Either the company should be reasonably okay in terms of its books and franchise network (even if the promoter is not so good). Or, both the business and promoter should be strong. The question now is: Will the NBFC sector, which was a market favourite till 2018, get back its mojo on the street?

title: 11 IPOs set to list this week. GMPs signal listing returns of up to 90%
summary: India’s IPO calendar is packed with 11 listings this week, largely dominated by SME issues, even as fresh fundraising momentum slows. Grey market trends signal sharp listing gains in select names, led by E to E Transportation and Shyam Dhani Industries, while most others point to muted or flat debuts amid cautious sentiment.
